protocol_name: Study of drug susceptibility of slowly growing nontuberculous mycobacteria (NTM).
protocol_name_html: Study of drug susceptibility of slowly growing nontuberculous mycobacteria (NTM).
description:
The research protocol on the topic:

Study of drug susceptibility of slowly growing nontuberculous mycobacteria (NTM) contains information on sample collection, processing diagnostic material, culture growth, primary differentiation of the isolated culture, and determination of mycobacterial species, drug susceptibility testing of slowly growing nontuberculous mycobacteria prevailing in Moscow region, MICs determination by Sensititre SlowMyco test.
protocol_affiliation: Scientific and Clinical Antituberculosis Center of Moscow Government Health Department, Russia
affiliation: Scientific and Clinical Antituberculosis Center of Moscow Government Health Department, Russia
manuscript_citation: Litvinov V, Makarova M, Galkina K, Khachaturiants E, Krasnova M, Guntupova L, Safonova S (2018) Drug susceptibility testing of slowly growing non-tuberculous mycobacteria using slomyco test-system. PLoS ONE 13(9): e0203108. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0203108
keywords: slowly growing nontuberculous mycobacteria, drus susceptibility testing, MIC detemination, Sensititre SlowMyco
authors: Litvinov V.I.,Makarova M.V.,Galkina K.Yu.,Khachaturiants E.N.,Krasnova М.А.,Guntupova L.D.,Safonova S.G.

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"97nj0","text":"Samples of respiratory material in a volume of 10-25 ml collected in sterile polypropylene 50 ml tubes with a hermetically sealed cap (Corning, USA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dcht","text":"All samples used in a study were coded and lacked personal information about the patients","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3scvt","text":"Centrifugation of the samples was carried out at an acceleration of 3000g for 20 minutes ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"c0u34","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"13766","duration":"1200","label":"","guid":"8DE566A0F8E442F7B701691734A64211"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4b25i","text":"Sample inoculated into liquid medium Middlebrook 7H9 in BACTECTMMGITTM960 system according to manufacturer's manual (Becton, Dickinson, USA)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5aush","text":" http:\/\/www.bd.com\/ds\/technicalCenter\/clsi\/clsi-960pza.pdf ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":59,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http:\/\/www.bd.com\/ds\/technicalCenter\/clsi\/clsi-960pza.pdf"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9dg98","text":"Primary differentiation of the isolated culture of acid-fast mycobacteria belonging to Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex from nontuberculous mycobacteria (NTM) performed according to their growth rate, colony morphology, Ziehl-Neelsen smear microscopy, and immunohromatographic 'BD MGIT TBC ID' (Becton, Dickinson, USA) test","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6k726","text":" http:\/\/www.bd.com\/contentmanager\/b_article.asp ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":48,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http:\/\/www.bd.com\/contentmanager\/b_article.asp"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dik7g","text":"Isolate suspensions were prepared from NTM culture and adjusted to 0.5 McFarland standard, and 100 \u03bcl of the suspension was transferred into a tube with a Mueller-Hinton nutrient broth until a final concentration of 1 \u00d7 105 -1 \u00d7 106 CFU\/ml obtained.10. A 100 \u03bcl aliquot of the final inoculum was transferred into each well of the SlowMyco plate, and plates was covered with an adhesive seal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5qb8","text":"The culture suspension incubated at 37 \u00b0 C in 5% CO2 for 7-14 days, depending on the growth of mycobacteria in drug-free control well. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"k04h","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"814","temperature":"37","unit":"10","label":"","guid":"621E0A87BB134C65A449B9F4855EAA65"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fiehv","text":"A 100 \u03bcl aliquot of the final inoculum was transferred into each well of the SlowMyco plate, and plates were covered with an adhesive seal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4ra4t","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":"5426","amount":"100","unit":"1","label":"","guid":"233E1BBEE51F4893A9004EB10C75907B"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"95cu2","text":"Identification of the species of NTM culture was carried out by the Hain Lifescience test system\u00a0 and biochemical tests (niacin, nitrate reductase, semi-quantitative catalase, urease, arylsulfatase, Tween-80 hydrolysis, determination of thermostable catalase and potassium tellurite potency).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ivea","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9i1b5","text":" https:\/\/www.hain-lifescience.de\/en\/ ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":37,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/www.hain-lifescience.de\/en\/"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ane9p","text":"Drug susceptibility testing of slowly growing MTM was done by Sensititre SlowMyco test system (TREK DIAGNOSTIC Systems Ltd., GB)\u00a0","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"95kdr","text":" http:\/\/www.trekds.com\/ ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":24,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http:\/\/www.trekds.com\/"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aeidc","text":"To interpret the results, we used the meanings of MICs indicating the resistance to the drug, as recommended in CLSI M24-A2 (2011). Ltd., GB)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"1h0ek","text":" https:\/\/global.ihs.com\/doc_detail.cfm?document_name=CLSI%20M24&item_s_key=00591769 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":84,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https:\/\/global.ihs.com\/doc_detail.cfm?document_name=CLSI%20M24&item_s_key=00591769"}}]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fmp6m","text":"The MIC was recorded as the lowest antibiotic concentration that reduced the visible growth of mycobacteria in the well, and its determination was carried out with the Vizion TREK (DIAGNOSTIC Systems Ltd., GB)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"akql1","text":" http:\/\/www.trekds.com\/ ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":0,"length":24,"key":0}],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http:\/\/www.trekds.com\/"}}]}
